comment: I think there was a bit of a cultural barrier. She really tries to help you understand the content, and does the best she can. I got an A. The content is easy to grasp. Make sure you do your work and you'll be fine.

The quality of the class significantly improved after the first half of the semester. After the first half, Dr. Rahnama adjusted the material to better reflect what her students would benefit from knowing as non-med students. She really appears to want her students to do well. If you're having difficulties in her class, email her for advice.

Good professor and knowledgeable about the subject. 
If you send her an email, she responds really quickly and explain the question very well. 
Great professor and definitely recommend her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Assignments and quizzes were often badly worded and the textbook was confusing. She rarely took constructive criticism on the course content either, which was extremely disheartening as I really did work hard in the class. She seemed like a nice person, but I would not take a class from her again.

Her course work is fairly easy you just have to read the chapters and complete reading quizzes. There are only 3 big assignments and her grading criteria is super confusing. She does not know how to use d2L and her syllabus does not line up with due dates on d2l. She does email back in a timely matter but she often ignores your questions. RUDE AF
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things
